results.title: Studs Terkel's Chicago
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, John McGreevy Productions and Nielsen-Ferns International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
Studs Terkel, a resident of Chicago since his childhood, proudly displays the city and its ‘ethnic parade’. The ‘parade’ takes us on a view of Picasso’s statue, of Louis Sullivan’s skyscrapers, on a ride on the ‘El’ and a visit to the ‘Loop’. Terkel also takes us to the Chicago River, the Art Institute, Lincoln Park, Maxwell Street and finally, into the ethnic areas decorated by proud people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, John McGreevy Productions and Nielsen-Ferns International

results.title: Peter Ustinov's Leningrad
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, John McGreevy Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
Presents Peter Ustinov’s personal view of Leningrad. He briefly relates the city’s history, showing many of the buildings - St. Peter and St. Paul Cathedral, the Imperial Winter Palace, St. Isaac’s Cathedral, amongst many others. He discusses many aspects of the arts, literature, music ballet and drama of Leningrad.

results.title: Jonathan Miller's London
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
Dr Jonathan Miller gives his personal view of the historical development of the city of London including his own personal upbringing in that city.

results.title: Sudden departure
results.creator_credit: Georges Dufaux, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: When an infant or small child enters hospital, there can be dangerous emotional shock caused by separation from the mother. Filmed at a children’s hospital, this film examines the nature of the child’s deprivation. A psychiatrist discusses what parents can do to lessen fear and anxiety. (Awards: Cairo; La Plata.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Georges Dufaux, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Successful sound for video
results.creator_credit: Chris Wonsky, Mik Parsons and ViT
results.brief_description: To create a successful video story it is essential that the correct type of sound is used for each shot. This video describes the situations in which both sync sound and non-sync sound should be used. It also discusses the issues surrounding different types of microphones (handheld, gun, personal), Mono and stereo soundtracks, recording non-sync sound (tape recorders, video camera recorder, commercial sound effects recordings), sound levels and distortion (under- and over-modulation) and mixing sounds using equalisers to control relative volumes, tone and the positioning of sound.
results.description: To create a successful video story it is essential that the correct type of sound is used for each shot. This video describes the situations in which both sync sound and non-sync sound should be used. results.title: Melina Mercouri's Athens
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
The vivacity of Melina Mercouri - singer, actress and parliamentarian, shines through as she reveals Athens as “a city with ancient ruins but with a heart that beats stronger than ever before”.

group_works.title: Subversive desires
group_works.creator_credit: George E. Saxon, George Snow, Julie Kuzminska, Akiko Hada, London Electronic Arts and WKBC-TV

results.title: Subversive desires
results.creator_credit: George E. Saxon, George Snow, Julie Kuzminska, Akiko Hada, London Electronic Arts and WKBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Video burn”.
A collection of contemporary video music clips which explore some of the avant-garde electronic music and performance coming from Great Britain. As the title for the collection suggests, this volume of “Video Burn” explores themes of sexuality and transgression. All the video artists involved have attempted to trace modern experimentation with sex, fashion and gender in forms which arise from 19th century popular theatre: the circus, gambling, and pantomime. In “The Jack Series”, George E. Saxon uses the myth of Jack the Ripper to examine the decadence of Victorian sexuality and how it still resonates today in sado-masochistic imagery; “Archaos”, by Julie Kuziminska, is a video celebration of the anarchic circus troupe of the same name; and “Assignation” is a video performance of an Edgar Allan Poe short story which brings the story’s sublimated sexuality to the fore.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George E. Saxon, George Snow, Julie Kuzminska, Akiko Hada, London Electronic Arts and WKBC-TV

results.title: Successful lighting for video
results.creator_credit: Chris Wonsky, Mik Parsons and ViT
results.brief_description: This video emphasises the importance of lighting in successfully portraying the subject of a shot in a video. The areas covered include: contrast; quality; intensity; direction and colour.
